42#include <config.h>
43
44#include <stdio.h>
45#include <stdlib.h>
46#include <string.h>
47#include <time.h>
48#include <ctype.h>
49
50#include <isc/tm.h>
51#include <isc/util.h>
52
53/*
54 * Portable conversion routines for struct tm, replacing
55 * timegm() and strptime(), which are not available on all
56 * platforms and don't always behave the same way when they
57 * are.
58 */
59
60/*
61 * We do not implement alternate representations. However, we always
62 * check whether a given modifier is allowed for a certain conversion.
63 */
64#define ALT_E 0x01
65#define ALT_O 0x02
66#define LEGAL_ALT(x) { if ((alt_format & ~(x)) != 0) return (0); }
67
68#ifndef TM_YEAR_BASE
69#define TM_YEAR_BASE 1900
70#endif
71
72static const char *day[7] = {
73 "Sunday", "Monday", "Tuesday", "Wednesday", "Thursday",
74 "Friday", "Saturday"
75};
76static const char *abday[7] = {
77 "Sun", "Mon", "Tue", "Wed", "Thu", "Fri", "Sat"
78};
79static const char *mon[12] = {
80 "January", "February", "March", "April", "May", "June", "July",
81 "August", "September", "October", "November", "December"
82};
83static const char *abmon[12] = {
84 "Jan", "Feb", "Mar", "Apr", "May", "Jun",
85 "Jul", "Aug", "Sep", "Oct", "Nov", "Dec"
86};
87static const char *am_pm[2] = {
88 "AM", "PM"
89};
90
91static int
92conv_num(const char **buf, int *dest, int llim, int ulim) {
93 int result = 0;
94
95 /* The limit also determines the number of valid digits. */
96 int rulim = ulim;
97
98 if (**buf < '0' || **buf > '9')
99 return (0);
100
101 do {
102 result *= 10;
103 result += *(*buf)++ - '0';
104 rulim /= 10;
105 } while ((result * 10 <= ulim) &&
106 rulim && **buf >= '0' && **buf <= '9');
107
108 if (result < llim || result > ulim)
109 return (0);
110
111 *dest = result;
112 return (1);
113}
114
115time_t
116isc_tm_timegm(struct tm *tm) {
117 time_t ret;
118 int i, yday = 0, leapday;
119 int mdays[] = { 31, 28, 31, 30, 31, 30, 31, 31, 30, 31, 30 };
120
121 leapday = ((((tm->tm_year + 1900 ) % 4) == 0 &&
122 ((tm->tm_year + 1900 ) % 100) != 0) ||
123 ((tm->tm_year + 1900 ) % 400) == 0) ? 1 : 0;
124 mdays[1] += leapday;
125
126 yday = tm->tm_mday - 1;
127 for (i = 1; i <= tm->tm_mon; i++)
128 yday += mdays[i - 1];
129 ret = tm->tm_sec +
130 (60 * tm->tm_min) +
131 (3600 * tm->tm_hour) +
132 (86400 * (yday +
133 ((tm->tm_year - 70) * 365) +
134 ((tm->tm_year - 69) / 4) -
135 ((tm->tm_year - 1) / 100) +
136 ((tm->tm_year + 299) / 400)));
137 return (ret);
138}
139
140char *
141isc_tm_strptime(const char *buf, const char *fmt, struct tm *tm) {
142 char c, *ret;
143 const char *bp;
144 size_t len = 0;
145 int alt_format, i, split_year = 0;
146
147 REQUIRE(buf != NULL);
148 REQUIRE(fmt != NULL);
149 REQUIRE(tm != NULL);
150
151 memset(tm, 0, sizeof(struct tm));
152
153 bp = buf;
154
155 while ((c = *fmt) != '\0') {
156 /* Clear `alternate' modifier prior to new conversion. */
157 alt_format = 0;
158
159 /* Eat up white-space. */
160 if (isspace((unsigned char) c)) {
161 while (isspace((unsigned char) *bp))
162 bp++;
163
164 fmt++;
165 continue;
166 }
167
168 if ((c = *fmt++) != '%')
169 goto literal;
170
171
172again: switch (c = *fmt++) {
173 case '%': /* "%%" is converted to "%". */
174literal:
175 if (c != *bp++)
176 return (0);
177 break;
178
179 /*
180 * "Alternative" modifiers. Just set the appropriate flag
181 * and start over again.
182 */
183 case 'E': /* "%E?" alternative conversion modifier. */
184 LEGAL_ALT(0);
185 alt_format |= ALT_E;
186 goto again;
187
188 case 'O': /* "%O?" alternative conversion modifier. */
189 LEGAL_ALT(0);
190 alt_format |= ALT_O;
191 goto again;
192
193 /*
194 * "Complex" conversion rules, implemented through recursion.
195 */
196 case 'c': /* Date and time, using the locale's format. */
197 LEGAL_ALT(ALT_E);
198 if (!(bp = isc_tm_strptime(bp, "%x %X", tm)))
199 return (0);
200 break;
201
202 case 'D': /* The date as "%m/%d/%y". */
203 LEGAL_ALT(0);
204 if (!(bp = isc_tm_strptime(bp, "%m/%d/%y", tm)))
205 return (0);
206 break;
207
208 case 'R': /* The time as "%H:%M". */
209 LEGAL_ALT(0);
210 if (!(bp = isc_tm_strptime(bp, "%H:%M", tm)))
211 return (0);
212 break;
213
214 case 'r': /* The time in 12-hour clock representation. */
215 LEGAL_ALT(0);
216 if (!(bp = isc_tm_strptime(bp, "%I:%M:%S %p", tm)))
217 return (0);
218 break;
219
220 case 'T': /* The time as "%H:%M:%S". */
221 LEGAL_ALT(0);
222 if (!(bp = isc_tm_strptime(bp, "%H:%M:%S", tm)))
223 return (0);
224 break;
225
226 case 'X': /* The time, using the locale's format. */
227 LEGAL_ALT(ALT_E);
228 if (!(bp = isc_tm_strptime(bp, "%H:%M:%S", tm)))
229 return (0);
230 break;
231
232 case 'x': /* The date, using the locale's format. */
233 LEGAL_ALT(ALT_E);
234 if (!(bp = isc_tm_strptime(bp, "%m/%d/%y", tm)))
235 return (0);
236 break;
237
238 /*
239 * "Elementary" conversion rules.
240 */
241 case 'A': /* The day of week, using the locale's form. */
242 case 'a':
243 LEGAL_ALT(0);
244 for (i = 0; i < 7; i++) {
245 /* Full name. */
246 len = strlen(day[i]);
247 if (strncasecmp(day[i], bp, len) == 0)
248 break;
249
250 /* Abbreviated name. */
251 len = strlen(abday[i]);
252 if (strncasecmp(abday[i], bp, len) == 0)
253 break;
254 }
255
256 /* Nothing matched. */
257 if (i == 7)
258 return (0);
259
260 tm->tm_wday = i;
261 bp += len;
262 break;
263
264 case 'B': /* The month, using the locale's form. */
265 case 'b':
266 case 'h':
267 LEGAL_ALT(0);
268 for (i = 0; i < 12; i++) {
269 /* Full name. */
270 len = strlen(mon[i]);
271 if (strncasecmp(mon[i], bp, len) == 0)
272 break;
273
274 /* Abbreviated name. */
275 len = strlen(abmon[i]);
276 if (strncasecmp(abmon[i], bp, len) == 0)
277 break;
278 }
279
280 /* Nothing matched. */
281 if (i == 12)
282 return (0);
283
284 tm->tm_mon = i;
285 bp += len;
286 break;
287
288 case 'C': /* The century number. */
289 LEGAL_ALT(ALT_E);
290 if (!(conv_num(&bp, &i, 0, 99)))
291 return (0);
292
293 if (split_year) {
294 tm->tm_year = (tm->tm_year % 100) + (i * 100);
295 } else {
296 tm->tm_year = i * 100;
297 split_year = 1;
298 }
299 break;
300
301 case 'd': /* The day of month. */
302 case 'e':
303 LEGAL_ALT(ALT_O);
304 if (!(conv_num(&bp, &tm->tm_mday, 1, 31)))
305 return (0);
306 break;
307
308 case 'k': /* The hour (24-hour clock representation). */
309 LEGAL_ALT(0);
310 /* FALLTHROUGH */
311 case 'H':
312 LEGAL_ALT(ALT_O);
313 if (!(conv_num(&bp, &tm->tm_hour, 0, 23)))
314 return (0);
315 break;
316
317 case 'l': /* The hour (12-hour clock representation). */
318 LEGAL_ALT(0);
319 /* FALLTHROUGH */
320 case 'I':
321 LEGAL_ALT(ALT_O);
322 if (!(conv_num(&bp, &tm->tm_hour, 1, 12)))
323 return (0);
324 if (tm->tm_hour == 12)
325 tm->tm_hour = 0;
326 break;
327
328 case 'j': /* The day of year. */
329 LEGAL_ALT(0);
330 if (!(conv_num(&bp, &i, 1, 366)))
331 return (0);
332 tm->tm_yday = i - 1;
333 break;
334
335 case 'M': /* The minute. */
336 LEGAL_ALT(ALT_O);
337 if (!(conv_num(&bp, &tm->tm_min, 0, 59)))
338 return (0);
339 break;
340
341 case 'm': /* The month. */
342 LEGAL_ALT(ALT_O);
343 if (!(conv_num(&bp, &i, 1, 12)))
344 return (0);
345 tm->tm_mon = i - 1;
346 break;
347
348 case 'p': /* The locale's equivalent of AM/PM. */
349 LEGAL_ALT(0);
350 /* AM? */
351 if (strcasecmp(am_pm[0], bp) == 0) {
352 if (tm->tm_hour > 11)
353 return (0);
354
355 bp += strlen(am_pm[0]);
356 break;
357 }
358 /* PM? */
359 else if (strcasecmp(am_pm[1], bp) == 0) {
360 if (tm->tm_hour > 11)
361 return (0);
362
363 tm->tm_hour += 12;
364 bp += strlen(am_pm[1]);
365 break;
366 }
367
368 /* Nothing matched. */
369 return (0);
370
371 case 'S': /* The seconds. */
372 LEGAL_ALT(ALT_O);
373 if (!(conv_num(&bp, &tm->tm_sec, 0, 61)))
374 return (0);
375 break;
376
377 case 'U': /* The week of year, beginning on sunday. */
378 case 'W': /* The week of year, beginning on monday. */
379 LEGAL_ALT(ALT_O);
380 /*
381 * XXX This is bogus, as we can not assume any valid
382 * information present in the tm structure at this
383 * point to calculate a real value, so just check the
384 * range for now.
385 */
386 if (!(conv_num(&bp, &i, 0, 53)))
387 return (0);
388 break;
389
390 case 'w': /* The day of week, beginning on sunday. */
391 LEGAL_ALT(ALT_O);
392 if (!(conv_num(&bp, &tm->tm_wday, 0, 6)))
393 return (0);
394 break;
395
396 case 'Y': /* The year. */
397 LEGAL_ALT(ALT_E);
398 if (!(conv_num(&bp, &i, 0, 9999)))
399 return (0);
400
401 tm->tm_year = i - TM_YEAR_BASE;
402 break;
403
404 case 'y': /* The year within 100 years of the epoch. */
405 LEGAL_ALT(ALT_E | ALT_O);
406 if (!(conv_num(&bp, &i, 0, 99)))
407 return (0);
408
409 if (split_year) {
410 tm->tm_year = ((tm->tm_year / 100) * 100) + i;
411 break;
412 }
413 split_year = 1;
414 if (i <= 68)
415 tm->tm_year = i + 2000 - TM_YEAR_BASE;
416 else
417 tm->tm_year = i + 1900 - TM_YEAR_BASE;
418 break;
419
420 /*
421 * Miscellaneous conversions.
422 */
423 case 'n': /* Any kind of white-space. */
424 case 't':
425 LEGAL_ALT(0);
426 while (isspace((unsigned char) *bp))
427 bp++;
428 break;
429
430
431 default: /* Unknown/unsupported conversion. */
432 return (0);
433 }
434
435
436 }
437
438 /* LINTED functional specification */
439 DE_CONST(bp, ret);
440 return (ret);
441}
